category.text: $course$/eur-descriptive-104-en-moodle/Descriptive statistics/Summary Statistics/Measures of Location/Mean, Descriptive statistics/Summary Statistics/Measures of Location/Median

questiontext.text: Fill in: “larger than”, “smaller than” or “equal to”: When a variable is normally distributed the mean is …. the median.

generalfeedback.text: When a variable is normally distributed the mean is equal to the median. A normally distributed variable is perfectly symmetric. This means that 50% of the observations is larger than the mean and 50% is smaller than the mean.
